Bengaluru

Bengaluru, Oct. 31 -- Around 79% of new customers during Amazon India's month-long Great Indian Festival sales, starting 2 October, were from non-metro cities such as Ernakulam, Guntur, Krishna and Godavari, it said on Friday.

"We are truly humbled to see how this festive season has brought joy to lakhs of sellers on Amazon with many becoming lakhpatis and crorepatis. We also witnessed great participation from over 360,000 micro and small enterprise buyers on Amazon Business this festive season. We take pride in being a part of their growth journey, while enabling them to get back on track," said Manish Tiwary, vice-president, Amazon India.

Kiranas and local businesses which joined the Local Shops programme, launched in April 2020, registered nearly two-fold growth during the festive sales. Categories such as large appliances, kitchen essentials, home entertainment and furniture continued to be top selling products for the Local Shops programme. Smartphones drove nearly 46% of the overall gross merchandise value during the first week of e-commerce sales events, according to estimates of management consultancy Redseer.

Amazon said over 1 million customers bought smartphones for the first time.

Mint reported on 14 October that e-commerce firms such as Amazon India and Walmart-owned Flipkart clocked GMV of $4.6 billion in the first week of the festive sales this year.
